Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2012 06:21PM - edited Nov 30, 2012 06:22PM by macyhen111 I know the feeling mirmirpanda, I was dx on Sept 24 2012. Had biopsy on Nov. 2. And double mastectomy Nov 18. I didn't have a lump that could be felt by my Pc Dr. I just had some pain. I was to begin my chemo on the 28th, but a pet scan showed possible mets in my hip and clivus bone in my head, so now I have mri's, bone scans, and bone biopsies scheduled for all next week. We have to keep praying and trusting that we are going to beat this. I have found such comfort coming here and talking to the other survivors on these boards. Keep your head up and try to stay as positive as you can.

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2013 12:03AM macyhen111 wrote: Thanks 5luvbugs and marianelizabeth. The first time I had the diarrhea my onc told me it was because I ate some oranges. So now I don't eat any raw fruits or veggies, but still have the runs. I really miss eating them. This cancer stuff has me so confused. I read everything I can about bc, but I usually am more confused because one will say one thing and then another will say the complete opposite. That's why I am on this site because I like to get the opinions of women who are going through the same things. I used to be really depressed and I had bad anxiety after my stage 4 diagnosis. My PcP gave me Prozac and klonopin, which has helped me out a lot.

Posts.Content: May 19, 2013 10:26AM macyhen111 wrote: I was initially diagnosed after my bmx with stage 2 bc. Then I had a Pet scan which revealed small mets to lytic hip, had it biopsied and was then given stage 4 status. I am happy that I was not staged at a 4 in the beginning because where my bc site was very painfull and I would hate to think that they might have left that there because of being stage 4 in the beginning. Now I am fighting the bc in the hip and am not in any pain. I don't miss my girl's at all. They were 3500(cancer site) and 3150. The only pain I had after surgery was the 4 drain sites.
Posts.Title: The point of removing breasts at Stage IV? SandyinPa macyhen111

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2012 08:59AM - edited Nov 27, 2012 09:01AM by macyhen111 Hi everyone, I was dx on September 24, I had my surgery, a modified radical mastectomy on the left side and a simple mast on the right, on October 18, all this is so new and foreign to me. I've never known anyone with Bc. I got my port put in on the 21st and I begin my chemo tomorrow. My onc prescribed zofran and phen for nausea. I don't know what to expect with chemo and I am scared. I don't mind losing my hair, I just don't want to feel sick. Should I take the nausea meds before I go for the chemo, or should I wait until I start feeling nauseated. I have seen a lot of post mentioning Claritin, what is it for and does it help. I have also seen that some of you request ativan, does it help. I am so confused, any and all advise will be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance !!

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2012 03:41PM macyhen111 wrote: I had my pet scan with drains still in, I went from a stage 2 to a stage 4 in less then a week. I got mammos every year and was told my left breast was dense, so they did ultrasound and found a cyst, funny it is in the same place my cancer was 2 years later. The mammo in between was supposedly clear. Soon after that one (which was last year in March) my breast started hurting. I told pcp he did manuel and said everything was fine. He did last manuel on 9/19/12,said no lumps everything fine. I was dx on 10/24/12. And now the bc has met to my right hip. Sigh!!!
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2012 07:09PM macyhen111 wrote: Thank you so much Ladies. I've said it before but I really do appreciate you all! What a caring and compassionate group of women you are. I have hope and I will always have faith that The Lord will see me through this journey. I used to ask why me? I lost my mother, father, sister and brother at a young age. When I asked the Lord please don't take my only remaining relative, my brother he did. But through all of that I have never questioned why. I just know that I was strong and never lost my faith. So no matter the outcome of this journey I am on, I know I'll be alright. I have my moments but then I try to think of all the positives in my life. I have 3 wonderful adult children and 2 granddaughters and of course my dh.
